sentences.english: She avoids big-ticket clothing items in case they may be counterfeit — as well as anything edible.
sentences.chinese: 她不買高價服裝以免碰到假貨，還有喫的東西。

sentences.english: The painting was bid in at the sale.
sentences.chinese: 在拍賣中畫主自己以高價買下。

sentences.english: He bought the ticket at a high price from a (ticket) scalper.
sentences.chinese: 他從一個票販子手裏高價買了張黃牛票。

sentences.english: Even the hides of "veal" calves are made into high-priced calfskin.
sentences.chinese: 即使是“食用”小牛犢也被用來製造高價的小牛犢皮。

sentences.english: Why weren’t people duped into favoring the high-priced candies and entrees?
sentences.chinese: 人們爲什麼不受高價糖果和主菜的誘惑？

sentences.english: Many higher-priced, high-fidelity earphones can sound harsh playing digital music.
sentences.chinese: 很多更高價的高保真耳機聽數碼音樂時會刺耳。

sentences.english: Money often buys higher-quality goods, but not when it comes to running shoes.
sentences.chinese: 高價往往能買到高質量的產品，但對跑鞋卻未必如此。
那個雜貨商總是要高價。

sentences.english: Each stock is trading roughly 30% below its 52-week high.
sentences.chinese: 兩者的交易價格大致都比其52周最高價低了30%。

sentences.english: He said would - be buyers have been ' constipated ' with high-priced stocks purchased last year.
sentences.chinese: 他說，潛在的買家尚未消化去年高價買進的大米。

sentences.english: I won't pay top prices for goods of inferior quality.
sentences.chinese: 我不願付高價買那些質量低劣的商品。

sentences.english: But first, you have to write your masterpiece and sell it to the highest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 但是首先，你必須寫出你的傑作並將它以高價賣出。

sentences.english: We usually buy low and sell high.
sentences.chinese: 我們通常低價買進高價賣出。

sentences.english: But, at the same time, high-price of the shops makes ordinary consumers dare not to enter.
sentences.chinese: 但同時，店內高價會另一般的顧客卻步。

sentences.english: And they specialise in selling overpriced novelty goods, really.
sentences.chinese: 他們專營高價的新奇的商品，真的。

sentences.english: Gold will probably hang on to these high levels.
sentences.chinese: 金價可能會緊緊抓住高價位。

definition: to quote a price/seller's first offer
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
unit (of measure)/unit (group of people as a whole)/work unit (place of employment, esp. in the PRC prior to economic reform)/CL:個|个[ge4]
parking spot/unloading point/garage place/stand for taxi
